question: Which helper-trigger policy best identifies stalled work without false alarms?
expect: Top-2 predictors: 'missing next_step' AND 'stale active >2 sessions'

blocked_not_none.verdict: NOT_A_PREDICTOR — blocked signal never appears in history

missing_or_vague_next_step.verdict: NOT_DISCRIMINATIVE — both statuses show same rate; useless as separator

actual_tbd_at_closure.verdict: INVERSE — abandoned lanes have actual filled in (with failure explanation); not a predictor

artifact_missing_on_disk.verdict: BEST_PREDICTOR — artifact path exists but file doesn't exist = reliable stall signal

stale_age_cross_session.explanation: 100% of MERGED lanes close in the SAME session they open. 100% of ABANDONED lanes persist past their opening session.
stale_age_cross_session.precision: 100% — if a lane survives to next session = stalled
stale_age_cross_session.verdict: BEST_PREDICTOR (tie) — but only detectable at SESSION BOUNDARY, not within session

predicted_vs_actual.predicted: missing next_step AND stale active >2 sessions are top-2
predicted_vs_actual.actual: stale_age >0 sessions is perfect; artifact_missing_on_disk is co-equal best predictor. missing_next_step is NOT discriminative (100% in both classes).
predicted_vs_actual.diff: Prediction partially wrong: stale age confirmed but only needs >0 sessions (not >2). missing_next_step useless as separator — next_step is vague for ALL lanes. Artifact existence is the real trigger.

recommended_trigger_policy.T1_primary: At session end: scan ACTIVE/BLOCKED lanes where artifact=<path> and file does not exist. Alert: lane X has missing artifact.
recommended_trigger_policy.T2_cross_session: At session start: any lane whose creation session != current session is STALLED. Trigger helper evaluation immediately.
recommended_trigger_policy.T3_false_positive_guard: Exclude lanes where artifact is a lesson ref (L-NNN format) or a directory. Check only file paths.
recommended_trigger_policy.false_alarm_analysis: Zero false alarms predicted — both T1 and T2 have 100% precision in 29-lane history. T2 may have higher false positive rate as swarm scales (planned multi-session lanes may emerge).
recommended_trigger_policy.implementation: Implement as orient.py maintenance check: 'STALE LANE DETECTED: <lane> opened S<N>, no artifact on disk, cross-session. Helper trigger: execute or close.'

cross_domain_isomorphism.iso: ISO-14 (all disciplines share artifact production as completion gate)
cross_domain_isomorphism.insight: The swarm's lane completion model matches manufacturing just-in-time: work items that don't convert to artifact in one pass are waste. Multi-session lanes = WIP (work-in-progress) waste. The trigger policy should be a kanban WIP limit: max 0 cross-session open lanes per domain.

actual: CONFIRMED + prediction partially wrong. stale_age >0 (not >2) is perfect predictor (100% precision/recall). artifact_missing_on_disk tied for best. missing_next_step useless (100% in all classes). blocked signal never appears.
diff: Stale age threshold was wrong (0 not 2). Real insight: one-shot completion is the baseline norm — any cross-session lane is already stalled. Artifact existence is the tangible check.
lesson_candidate: L-514: Lane stall detection — artifact existence + stale age are the only reliable triggers
